org.jchassis.termctl
Interface TerminalController

All Known Implementing Classes:
TerminalController
public interface TerminalController

An interface for controlling a text terminal. A terminal should initally be in the "default" state, defined in the init() method's documentation.

Copyright © 2003-2005 Sam Stainsby.
Verbatim copying and distribution of this entire generated javadoc document is permitted in any medium, provided this notice is preserved.

Field Detail

KEYBOARD_INPUT_EVENT_ROLE

static final EventRole KEYBOARD_INPUT_EVENT_ROLE
the role for an event represeint the input of a single character through the keyboard - the event value must be an Integer, representing the ASCII key code

Method Detail

init

void init()
          throws TerminalIoException
Tries to initialise the terminal to its default state. The default state is: the terminal screen is cleared and the cursor is in the home position. Also, wrapping should be off when in the default state: cursor movements should not wrap when an attempt is made to move the cursor past an edge of the screen in any direction. Finally, no character styles should be applied (bold, blink, etc.) and character colors should be white text on a black background.

Throws:
TerminalIoException

reset

void reset()
           throws TerminalIoException
Resets the terminal. This should also leave the terminal in the default state, as described in the init() method documention . This method is indended to take more drastic action than init, by invoking the terminal's reset function if it has one, rather than just adjusting some attributes.

Throws:
TerminalIoException

moveCursor

void moveCursor(Direction direction)
                throws TerminalIoException
Moves the cursor one position in the specified direction.

Parameters:
direction - the direction to move the cursor in
Throws:
TerminalIoException

moveCursor

void moveCursor(Direction direction,
                int count)
                throws TerminalIoException
Moves the cursor in the specified direction.

Parameters:
direction - the direction to move the cursor in
count - the number of positions to move the cursor in the specified direction; a value of zero results in no action
Throws:
TerminalIoException

putCharacter

void putCharacter(char ch)
                  throws TerminalIoException
Puts the specified character at the current cursor position. The cursor will move forward (i.e. to the right) one position.

Parameters:
ch - the character to put
Throws:
TerminalIoException

putCharacters

void putCharacters(java.lang.String chars)
                   throws TerminalIoException
Puts the specified characters at the current cursor position and moving forward one position for each character.

Parameters:
chars - the characters to put
Throws:
TerminalIoException

getCursorPosition

Point getCursorPosition()
                        throws TerminalIoException
Gets the current cursor position. Positions are based at (0,0), not (1,1).

Returns:
the cursor's position
Throws:
TerminalIoException

setCursorPosition

void setCursorPosition(Point position)
                       throws TerminalIoException
Sets the current cursor position. Positions are based at (0,0), not (1,1).

Parameters:
position - the position to move the cursor to
Throws:
TerminalIoException

home

void home()
          throws TerminalIoException
Sets the cursor in the home position. This is equivalent to settting the cursor position to (0,0).

Throws:
TerminalIoException

beep

void beep()
          throws TerminalIoException
Issues a warning such as an audible beep.

Throws:
TerminalIoException

eraseScreen

void eraseScreen()
                 throws TerminalIoException
Erases the terminal screen.

Throws:
TerminalIoException

getScreenSize

Dimension getScreenSize()
                        throws TerminalIoException
Gets the size of the screen.

Returns:
the screen dimesions in terms of characters positions (columns x rows).
Throws:
TerminalIoException

setInputEnabled

void setInputEnabled(boolean on)
Enables or disables keyboard input.

getEventSource

EventSource getEventSource()
Gets the event source for events generated by this terminal. Typically, this will just be a source of keyboard input events.
